title: Cheesecake in a Jar
description: Make cheesecake in a jar for the perfect portable summer dessert that's incredibly easy to make and a delicious way to use seasonal strawberries.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Desserts Cakes Cheesecake Recipes Cheesecake in a Jar 4.8 (92) 69 Reviews 25 Photos Cheesecake in a jar is perfect for summer picnics. This is a no-bake version of cheesecake with fresh strawberries. Submitted by RuthE Updated on April 10, 2023 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 25 25 25 25 Prep Time: 55 mins Additional Time: 2 hrs Total Time: 2 hrs 55 mins Servings: 6 Yield: 6 jars Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings 6 pecan shortbread cookies (such as Keebler Sandies), finely crushed 2 tablespoons butter, melted 2 tablespoons white sugar 6 (1/2 pint) canning jars with lids 12 ounces sliced fresh strawberries 1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, softened ½ cup white sugar 2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice ½ cup heavy cream, whipped Directions Mix cookie crumbs, butter, and 2 tablespoons sugar in a bowl until combined. Divide mixture evenly among jars, about 3 1/2 tablespoons each, and gently press (do not pack) into bottoms. Halve 6 strawberries for garnish, and set aside. Chop remaining strawberries. Beat cream cheese, 1/2 cup sugar, and lemon juice in bowl with an electric mixer at medium speed until smooth. Fold in whipped cream and chopped berries; divide evenly among jars, about 1/2 cup each. Top each with a 2 berry halves and cover with lids. Chill at least 2 hours and up to 3 days. Allrecipes Magazine I Made It Print 408 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 413 Calories 29g Fat 36g Carbs 5g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 6 Calories 413 % Daily Value * Total Fat 29g 38% Saturated Fat 16g 81% Cholesterol 83mg 28% Sodium 196mg 9% Total Carbohydrate 36g 13% Dietary Fiber 1g 4% Total Sugars 27g Protein 5g 9% Vitamin C 35mg 39% Calcium 53mg 4% Iron 1mg 4% Potassium 153mg 3% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Cheesecake in a Jar 01 of 25 Photo by  Allrecipes Magazine 02 of 25 Photo by  Kelley Gillies McPate 09/13/2020 03 of 25 Photo by  Sharon Albers Hynes 06/15/2020 04 of 25 Photo by  Tawana B 06/02/2020 05 of 25 Photo by  My 3 boys 04/26/2020 loved it 06 of 25 Photo by  Jes 03/11/2020 07 of 25 Photo by  CJH 11/28/2019 Fantastic! In the interest of honesty, I didn't want to buy strawberries and jars when I had caramel apple pie filling and cupcake liners already in my pantry. So, I made caramel apple cheesecake in cupcake liners. BUT the cheesecake recipe remained unchanged and came out the perfect flavor and consistency. I was comfortable changing the recipe since I was only making this for myself, but next time I have company, I'll follow the recipe exactly (including the jars), and I know it will be wonderful. 08 of 25 Photo by  Christine Snyder 08/26/2019 Made these for my bf for easy snack while he's on the road, he LOVES THEM! Many ways to change this recipe up to your liking, I will be making these many times!!! 09 of 25 Photo by  linda 08/24/2019 I tripled the recipe and made a full pan for a barbecue today one of the most delicious thing that ever had!!! I have made it at the holidays in the jars ...very nice personal gife 10 of 25 Photo by  diananycum 08/18/2019 1 2 3 Next You’ll Also Love No-Bake Cheesecake Flag Cake 172 Ratings No-Bake Greek Yogurt Cheesecake 1 Rating Blueberry Cheesecake 119 Ratings Strawberry Cheesecake 319 Ratings Strawberry Cheesecake in a Jar 18 Ratings Lemon Souffle Cheesecake with Blueberry Topping 127 Ratings Chai Spice "Cheesecake" 2 Ratings Strawberry Lemonade Cheesecake 2 Ratings White Chocolate Blueberry Cheesecake 110 Ratings Cheesecake 47 Ratings White Chocolate Raspberry Cheesecake 3,434 Ratings Mini Strawberry Cheesecakes 17 Strawberry Cheesecake Recipes for Fans of Fruity Desserts Blueberry Shortbread Cheesecake 25 Ratings Strawberry Oreo Cheesecake No-Bake Blueberry Cheesecake 87 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: RuthE
instructions: Mix cookie crumbs, butter, and 2 tablespoons sugar in a bowl until combined. Divide mixture evenly among jars, about 3 1/2 tablespoons each, and gently press (do not pack) into bottoms.;Halve 6 strawberries for garnish, and set aside. Chop remaining strawberries.;Beat cream cheese, 1/2 cup sugar, and lemon juice in bowl with an electric mixer at medium speed until smooth. Fold in whipped cream and chopped berries; divide evenly among jars, about 1/2 cup each. Top each with a 2 berry halves and cover with lids. Chill at least 2 hours and up to 3 days. Allrecipes Magazine
